page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area under study is lowly populated farming land,with the exception of the village of East Leake which is situated at the N.E.corner of the block. East Leake has grown, in recent times, from a small rural community into a large village of some 6000 people.The reasons for the new housing are:-the proximatey of the M1,a nearby airport and power station,two local universities,easy access to both heavy and light industry. The newcomers have arrived from all over Great Britain and have settled in well. The small village of West Leake lies to the west of E.Leake There are several farms within the area.The farming is mixed and the soil is heavy.
